metadata.title: CVE-2017-5024 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac,failed to perform proper bounds checking, which allowed a remote attackerto potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted video file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-browser-l10n - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-chromedriver - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.4-1
libav-tools - 7:3.2.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu2.1343').
ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.4-1').
